column5: After a lot of research (thanks for the opinions) I am taking my 15 year old son on a fly-in (first time fly-in) to White Clay Lake. We are using Ogoki Frontier. We would appreciate any trip reports or advice or opinions concerning Ogoki and White Clay.Thanks

You made a good choice with Ogoki Frontier. Paul will give you all the advice you need when you arrive, including marking your lake map with all the hotspots. White Clay is a big piece of water with several other camps and great fishing. We were at Chipchase last Sept., Kathleen next. Have fun, and be careful out there.Larry
Snagmaster - we were considering Chipchase. How did you do there?
Any more info would be appreciated.

>Snagmaster - we were considering Chipchase. How did you do >there? went to chipchase last year mid july and did great brought my 16 year old twin boys went to whiteclay the year before and did very good also Rick

sorry for posting on the wrong spot we liked both chipchase and whiteclay, whiteclay is alot larger than chipchase but you will never have any problem with it being to windy we were at whiteclay in early july and the fishing was great there was a sunken island abought inthe middle of the lake and we caught 100s of eyes there on jigs and salted minniows also leeches nand crawlers 6to 12 ft bassicly about the same at chipchase, paul runs a first class operation and I would go with him any time exellent boats and cleancabins with showers good luck Rick

SWWe had the best walleye fishing ever at Chipchase. Over 600 for two guys. We found them deep in September. And as Paul says, "they got some shoulders". Fattest walleyes we've ever seen. Biggest was 25 1/2". Be careful out there.Lar
